posts.body:
>>db23a945-34a7-494d-a0cc-a9ff03344c39
I've seen that a few times but it seems to be something wrong within ZeroNet itself when it fails to load an image (hence ''Internal error'').
Not sure if there is much we can do on our side to prevent it if it's actually the case.
I will dig around when I have some time.

>>8ef6bceb-5641-441c-a498-6f4e3cfdd7dd
>Can we not be forced to do:
>Seed -> Wait -> Download All
Which alternative do you propose?

>I dont want a billion copies of everything i download to be on my system.
You literally cannot download anything without creating a copy on your system.

>>720594d6-f25d-43b0-a814-10a40211628e
>Click "Download All", Images downloaded to /tmp, rar'd up, downloaded to browsers default download location, deleted from /tmp.
Not possible. Once the images are downloaded we don't have access to them anymore.
That's the reason everything is done in memory.

It sounds like what you want is an option to delete all the downloaded files after they've been archived and downloaded.

>>ff73292b-e3ab-40f3-b728-f8f829461256
What kind of potato are you using to browse here?
Have you tried disabling/enabling `lazy load posts` in the user options?
Another option is decreasing the number of `threads per page`.

>>509dd14d-62d9-4136-b1d0-45e878ac5b80
>finding there are things I don't want to see 
How are you finding that?
If from the recent posts in the front page you can just search for the board name and blacklist it.
To blacklist the user you can click the post and then blacklist it using the menu as >>382b2fba-357c-45f5-9ae4-e6e9d5d35de1 explained.

>In which file are saved these seeding instructions?
data/sites.json.
In the `1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA` object copy the `optional_help` object.
If you're not helping seed anyone's files this object might not exist.

Apparently this file also doesn't update immediately after a change so if you changed the list of users you're helping recently you may need to force the data to be written to the disk.
Click "Check files" in the Millchan options of ZeroHello, wait for the files to sync and see if check if problem will persist.

Works on my machine.
Did you add any hubs after granting permission in the merger site?

>>3e41311a-5b0d-41d2-97cd-f460890ab8e0

posts.subject: Spring 2020
posts.body:
What is /a/ watching this season?

Tower of God seems promising.
Gleipnir is a trainwreck but entertaining enough so far.
Yesterday is decent but it might turn into 12 episodes of nothing happening.
Kaguya is still fun. AOTS.

posts.body:
>>17db6457-ed6a-4bf9-91a3-26984111fc8c
It depends on what you enjoy.
Kakushigoto is a comedy you may want to check if you enjoyed things like Sayonara, Zetsubou-Sensei and Joshiraku since they were all written by the same author.
Appare-Ranman is about a couple of guys going in an adventure. Not great but watchable if you enjoy that kind of thing.
Hamefura is something people seem to be enjoying but it's not particularly my cup of tea.
Finally, there is Houkago Teibou Nisshi if you're looking for your CGDCT fix.

posts.body:
Is there a viable alternative to ZeroNet for dynamic content yet?
ZeroNet's development has ceased to a halt and I don't any sign that things are about to change anytime soon.

On the other hand, IPFS is still being actively developed and now even has built-in support in some browsers.
The main issue with it is having to rely on hacks to make it work for dynamic content since network was built primarily for static content.
Another problem is the lack of Tor support which apparently was already implemented but for whatever reasons it was taking forever to be merged to the main branch of the project.
Maybe things have improved by now.

Anyway, it might be time to move this project to somewhere else.
posts.subject: ZeroNet alternatives

posts.body:
>>2955734a-64ac-4854-b8b7-650bb2de9464
Sounds like you're using an old version of ZeroNet.
Try updating to the latest version.
Which version and rev of ZeroNet you're running?

>>b8987a21-7eb0-4329-a65e-9fee72e6d69b
Yes that's a fairly outdated revision.
The error is because you're missing something that was implemented in rev4458.
Updating will likely fix the problem.

>>c51af2b9-76db-447f-9d6a-8f1816f10d1a
>The error is because you're missing something that was implemented in ==rev4458==
Obviously ==4206== isn't going to work.
Also, no idea why it would take you all day.
The only thing you need to do is download the most recent version and then move your old data folder.

>>20124662-03b3-41c4-bf99-db67ea9938a4
https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet#install-from-source

Does the issue still happens if you click on the image directly?
If that's the case then it's upstream issue.

Either way, ZeroNet's peer counter is very inaccurate most of the time.
So it's definitely possible there is no one currently seeding those images but the API is mistakenly saying  there are multiple peers.

>>fdf44e36-5799-4e56-b258-88892e7d19bc
Unfortunately not much we can do about it in that case other than hope that ZeroNet will get its shit together and fix it someday.

I tested on multiple browsers but I couldn't reproduce that issue specifically.
However that was something related to it that has been fixed.
Perhaps that one was fixed as well.

Also, make sure you're using the latest ZeroNet revision (4486) and Millchan at 8760354.

posts.files: [{"name":"[HorribleSubs] Kaguya-sama wa Kokurasetai S2 - 09 [720p]_00:06:30.056.jpg","thumb":"4fdc46f901c559684d87c045ba4915e51262f315-thumb.jpg","size":87500,"type":"image/jpeg","original":"4fdc46f901c559684d87c045ba4915e51262f315.jpg","directory":"1JeThywpsb1kDjfj41sKxWQkFHd6SkcsQ8"},{"name":"[HorribleSubs] Kaguya-sama wa Kokurasetai S2 - 09 [720p]_00:05:55.062.jpg","thumb":"36c3e220d9b29402f72f6ad0d92dfa17e80920d4-thumb.jpg","size":61807,"type":"image/jpeg","original":"36c3e220d9b29402f72f6ad0d92dfa17e80920d4.jpg","directory":"1JeThywpsb1kDjfj41sKxWQkFHd6SkcsQ8"},{"name":"[HorribleSubs] Kaguya-sama wa Kokurasetai S2 - 09 [720p]_00:05:20.987.jpg","thumb":"c7ed686ded0a7381060ab38c69ec287a62ec9088-thumb.jpg","size":129906,"type":"image/jpeg","original":"c7ed686ded0a7381060ab38c69ec287a62ec9088.jpg","directory":"1JeThywpsb1kDjfj41sKxWQkFHd6SkcsQ8"},{"name":"[HorribleSubs] Kaguya-sama wa Kokurasetai S2 - 09 [720p]_00:04:01.491.jpg","thumb":"de2f1d11557955a04cd24a6e5e5b0c63c8af4057-thumb.jpg","size":82750,"type":"image/jpeg","original":"de2f1d11557955a04cd24a6e5e5b0c63c8af4057.jpg","directory":"1JeThywpsb1kDjfj41sKxWQkFHd6SkcsQ8"}]

posts.body:
>>3c801386-8cd2-4324-a0a5-f3a879bdc54e
>ZN version
Click the "3 dots" in the ZeroHello page.

>Millchan
The string at the very bottom of the page after you click on `MILLCHAN ENGINE`.

>>f44e6ea0-2e71-4290-8df4-015f91b70a13
It might be a security thing that is preventing the download prompt from being triggered from within the iframe.
You could try a different browser to confirm if that's the case.

Either way, there should be a popup with a link to the archive from now on.
You just have to click it if the download prompt doesn't show up.

Duplicated >>42994b19-d33c-4d02-b648-f6c9566de151

==Update ZeroNet to the latest revision (4486)==

>>eb15a308-08aa-430a-8a88-c8ee066e0f0c
>.jfif
I'm surprised that worked.

>>531e9cca-4499-40d5-ae57-b5c33f4f3372
>I have zeronet updated to 0.6.5 rev3870. So that's not the problem.
That's exactly the problem.
Update to 0.7.1 rev4486.
Thanks for the log. Is that happening only with big images or with small images as well?

It should be fixed now.
If you're still having problems you can try increasing the value of "jpegjs max memory" in the user menu.

The upload of webp files has been enabled.
It will only work in the Tor bundle if you allow access to the canvas element which is disabled by default.
It should work fine in other browsers **except IE and Safari.**

>When a user posts on my instance, ZeroNet throws an invalid content.json error.
Are you using the UI button to sign the users' content.json file?
If that's the case try signing using the command line.
No idea why but the former is broken for some reason and silently failing to generate the updated signature.
The latter should work fine though.

>how did you set up your own CA for Millchan?
We're not using a CA here. Certs are self-signed.
If you want to setup your own CA you can just do something similar to what ZeroID or KxoID do.
Alternatively, if you want to keep things fully decentralized, you can just generate and authenticate certs using a PoW based scheme.

>>10a83017-65f3-4391-a4f1-cfe7647668ed
>I'm not referring to the file data/users/content.json which appears in the UI and is signed. I'm talking about the content.json files generated when a user posts,
They are related. If the former isn't signed correctly you will get an error in the latter.
What is the exact error message that is being logged?

>"millchan": ["1NwwLdiFBcVAA4jXQ712ZtQfDHEMvk8BiD"],
Replace "millchan" with whatever you have defined in the "domain" of your config.ts file (lowercase).

I'm assuming you didn't change the "anonWIF" defined in that same file.

>>c019149a-f599-445d-af7d-8e3e23b4ef9a
>So then why can I post using @millchan or @zeroid.bit?
Did you run npm again after changing the config.ts file?

>I'm not certain what anonWIF is supposed to be.
The private key being used to sign the self-signed certificates.

If you're not going to change that the cert_signers for "zchan" should remain with the "1NwwLdiFBcVAA4jXQ712ZtQfDHEMvk8BiD" value

>>86a6ec46-7f5a-4ce5-9d21-459f8e6b5bfd
>I tried that now and I can still post with @millchan as my cert.
Just checked and it seems to be working fine.
The cert was generated as expected and anything outside "accepted_domains" is not available for selection.

You may be "posting" from @millchan because you're still stuck with the previously selected certificate.

>When I sign the content.json it reverts to the empty string.
Try signing it from the command line using the "siteSign" command as mentioned before.
Also make sure the json is correct/valid.

[code]
 "user_contents": {
  "cert_signers": {
   "zchan": ["1NwwLdiFBcVAA4jXQ712ZtQfDHEMvk8BiD"]
  },
[/code]

>>59b20b67-a664-454a-b0ea-646ad80efe50
Glad it worked for you. It seems the only thing missing is publishing the updated files then.

>One thing I don't understand is why the private key for cert signing is public.
The self-signed system is used to keep things decentralized.
It wouldn't be possible to self-sign certificates without access to private key.
Hence, the current system.

That answers you question from earlier, i.e. you don't need to be online for people to be able to create certificates.
But it does mean it would be trivial for someone to create as many certificates as they wish.
To prevent that you can use one of the aforementioned CA options.

>>245ca40a-78cd-47fc-b864-85c6fac25bbd
There is now a "Hide Thread" option in the thread menu that should behave more or less as you described.

Right now threads can only be hidden from the "board index".
Hidden threads will not appear in the catalog.
Hidden threads can be restored from the "board index" using the hidden thread stub.
Try openning the sidebar and click to rebuild the database.

Most browsers don't know to handle HEVC yet.
That's the reason it will be necessary to download it to be able to reproduce it and also the reason the thumbnails failed to be created.

>>771f77e9-8116-47b2-8023-c6729d7316c0
Probably an exif thing.
I will see if we can do something about it.

>>771f77e9-8116-47b2-8023-c6729d7316c0
>>b1aff953-56c8-4422-b5cd-4cae4562334d
It shouldn't happen anymore from now on but old thumbnails will still be fucked.

>>3ce97eb7-b54b-4553-a7ed-6731b2bda3af
ZeroNet bug. There is probably no one currently seeding the file.

posts.subject: Millchan refactor
posts.body:
Using this thread to keep track of a **possible** major refactor in Millchan.
Millchan's ''frontend'' is written in Vue and the library has recently released a new version which promises significant performance and usability improvements.
The idea is to update Millchan's code to use this new version and also refactor some other parts that could be improved. Some of the goals are:
- Use the setup syntax in all components (remove all mixins)
- All data should contain the datum type
- Setup imported functions should use TypeScript
- Components should be as small as possible
 (split and delegate responsibilities to other components if needed)
- Use functional components whenever possible
- All style should be in component's scoped style
 (remove all styles that are being applied directly / in other css files)
- Data that is shared between components should be in the store
- Store data should be accessed / mutated with the vuex helpers
  (enable vuex strict mode)
- Components' main flow should be unit tested

Unfortunately we depend on some libraries on the Vue's ecosystem that have not updated their code to be compatible with Vue 3.X yet.
We should be able to start the refactor once that has happened.

==ETA: N/A==

posts.body:
>>81765290-f057-4210-9e53-287f4938d6fc
It should be working now. Thanks for reporting.

Are you using a proxy?
Do you have the multiuser plugin enabled?

>>6ab7f436-0f70-4135-b627-97897894f617
What is causing the problem is probably the function that cleans up archived files on every new session.
No clue what is causing the permission problems though if it's not one of the cases above.
I'm also unsure what would be the best way to mitigate it.
I guess for now we can just add a checkbox to disable to auto cleanup of archived files but that means they will need to be deleted manually at some point.

You can now uncheck the "auto delete archived files" option in the user menu and see if the notifications will stop.

From now on ''most'' mp4 thumbnails (i.e. H.264) should generate fine from Tor.
Report here if you have any problems.
==Hello!==

>>7976cfbb-bcff-4569-81b5-54542b11b769
It should work fine now. It'd indeed be fixed earlier if it had been mentioned in /dev/.

posts.body:
Not sure why I'm only seeing this post now but most of those should've been fixed already.

>I currently cannot save the image as the original filename as I used to before.
Chromium based browsers stopped allowing triggering the download dialog from within an iframe.
To bypass that restriction the original filename download has been changed to display the link in a snackbar similarly to what happens when you archive all files in a post.

>it truncates it, and only saves the zip as whatever was after the symbol
That should be fixed as well.
If you notice more problematic characters feel free to open a PR to add it to the regex bellow.
https://gitgud.io/millchan/Millchan/-/blob/master/js/util.ts#L229

>File delete error: you don't own this site & you are not approved by the owner
Still trying to find a way to reproduce those authentication errors with very little luck so far.

Thanks for reporting.
S2 is out. Watch it.
posts.files: [{"name":"[SubsPlease] Yuru Camp S2 - 02 (720p) [BD80560E]_00:10:27.252.jpg","thumb":"a1e8599d355e1a2a1d829935dbeba8f86f1834af-thumb.jpg","size":128317,"type":"image/jpeg","original":"a1e8599d355e1a2a1d829935dbeba8f86f1834af.jpg","directory":"1JeThywpsb1kDjfj41sKxWQkFHd6SkcsQ8"},{"name":"[SubsPlease] Yuru Camp S2 - 02 (720p) [BD80560E]_00:08:45.484.jpg","thumb":"865dc544efbe8c3c924b04416c0eed28e94b055a-thumb.jpg","size":160311,"type":"image/jpeg","original":"865dc544efbe8c3c924b04416c0eed28e94b055a.jpg","directory":"1JeThywpsb1kDjfj41sKxWQkFHd6SkcsQ8"},{"name":"[SubsPlease] Yuru Camp S2 - 02 (720p) [BD80560E]_00:06:53.288.jpg","thumb":"12aafac6922db4b7b18a1a3ee2b6d697b73a2f0a-thumb.jpg","size":244270,"type":"image/jpeg","original":"12aafac6922db4b7b18a1a3ee2b6d697b73a2f0a.jpg","directory":"1JeThywpsb1kDjfj41sKxWQkFHd6SkcsQ8"},{"name":"[SubsPlease] Yuru Camp S2 - 02 (720p) [BD80560E]_00:05:14.523.jpg","thumb":"f7b79f083a47cf452fe754815821446493601fbc-thumb.jpg","size":149384,"type":"image/jpeg","original":"f7b79f083a47cf452fe754815821446493601fbc.jpg","directory":"1JeThywpsb1kDjfj41sKxWQkFHd6SkcsQ8"},{"name":"[SubsPlease] Yuru Camp S2 - 02 (720p) [BD80560E]_00:03:34.339.jpg","thumb":"c306c492bb329a6defe2527333c759d240430139-thumb.jpg","size":231381,"type":"image/jpeg","original":"c306c492bb329a6defe2527333c759d240430139.jpg","directory":"1JeThywpsb1kDjfj41sKxWQkFHd6SkcsQ8"}]

posts.body:
I think it's fine to leave this option disabled by default since thumbnails are lazy loaded and therefore will only be downloaded if they're within the browser's viewport.
At this point if he sees something that he does not want to seed he can just blacklist the user which should remove the content from the local client.
If that's not enough for someone he can always just enable the `Always spoiler` himself.

>I tried to fork millchan by me but in not an Expert and failed for now
I can't help you without knowing where and how exactly you failed.

>>b1cd72ca-94b6-4f0f-be39-531f2296012c
Glad to hear it worked for you although it sounds like it should've worked fine in old one as well.

Millchan no longer has any ''known'' bugs.
There are still some performance issues because of ZeroNet itself and some which will be mitigated by an eventual [Vue 3 refactor](/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/?:users/12NPW6WLFBLVivNGqijcfktARobftfLFAN:dev:a5c75e52-8393-4ac1-b7ea-422725653cfb:50)

>>08d6245d-c683-4a1d-95e9-fda94cea41e7
The code is open-source. You can see the exact commit which forced some users to rebuild their database.
All `schema_changed` in `dbschema.json` were updated.
[That alone should've forced the database to be rebuild](https://zeronet.io/docs/site_development/dbschema_json/).
The fact that didn't happen automatically to some people and they were forced to do it manually sounds like a ZeroNet bug to me.

>>1ae0c1cd-b086-405c-9221-fc0ced0ee05e
The issue is the video. ZeroNet needs a lot of memory to download it.
It should work if you try archiving the files now but the video will be skipped.
It should work fine now.

>>4cf09f66-3d0d-4bd8-95df-23fb1d4154b2
ZeroNet didn't publish the updated file for some reason. Try again.

The only way I see that happening is if you chose to help share all files of someone who has been posting in one of the porn boards you blacklisted.

>How can I find out where they are coming from?
Check the data.json file of the user who posted.

>Is it possible to mute the original poster to lessen the risk of this happening again?
Yes but ideal solution is to understand why it happened and fix it if it's a bug.

>>a5071346-ccbe-4b5d-b990-9af34d859327
What are the steps to reproduce that?
Just blacklisting the board seems to delete all the previously downloaded files just fine.

>>c7e7f57b-09a5-4b78-90bd-53fd1ddb49eb
>ticked "seed added optional files"
I see. That explains it.
The blacklist will be ignored if you tell ZeroNet to help share all optional files in Millchan.
Not much we can do about that. Probably better just to help the optional files of specific users instead.

>>a267751c-10ad-4d9e-8579-3d36c7e451b3
>no but its aesthetics can be improved.
Sure. Feel free to post suggestions or just do it and open a merge request.

>>b5121d5e-a19a-440a-9e57-b34b685d9ccb
>>e39dec79-6a31-44fe-8409-0c9005a8ceac
It sounds like you're using the outdated [python 2 branch](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/commits/master).
Try using the [py3 branch](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/commits/py3).

Good season. Comfy/10
Hopefully we'll see another season some day.
posts.files: [{"name":"[SubsPlease] Yuru Camp S2 - 13 (720p) [89B2EEFB]_00:02:08.128.jpg","thumb":"83ee60d3a2c74cb2446582acdd469919e4e9ebe9-thumb.jpg","size":140631,"type":"image/jpeg","original":"83ee60d3a2c74cb2446582acdd469919e4e9ebe9.jpg","directory":"1JeThywpsb1kDjfj41sKxWQkFHd6SkcsQ8"},{"name":"[SubsPlease] Yuru Camp S2 - 13 (720p) [89B2EEFB]_00:16:23.609.jpg","thumb":"e2e4729379bd1a20060d4bdf7099866b76b64a12-thumb.jpg","size":269475,"type":"image/jpeg","original":"e2e4729379bd1a20060d4bdf7099866b76b64a12.jpg","directory":"1JeThywpsb1kDjfj41sKxWQkFHd6SkcsQ8"},{"name":"[SubsPlease] Yuru Camp S2 - 13 (720p) [89B2EEFB]_00:14:32.289.jpg","thumb":"a81d1321b4838dc085ed26a8409a4aceed5ee568-thumb.jpg","size":149413,"type":"image/jpeg","original":"a81d1321b4838dc085ed26a8409a4aceed5ee568.jpg","directory":"1JeThywpsb1kDjfj41sKxWQkFHd6SkcsQ8"}]

posts.body:
>>0bd62310-bede-4d20-a908-5d3240406ae4
`Hide from recent posts` in the board menu.

>>b8f3ba27-9029-404f-80b0-5029f6e1b2f6
`ctrl` + `shift` + `I` then check if there are any errors in the console tab.

Also, it would be helpful knowing the browser you're using and the file's codecs/container.

>>dbd4f1e1-5fb1-4aee-b014-fb405bb78c3c
I see. Thanks for the log.

>[swscaler @ 0x3b05110] No accelerated colorspace conversion found from yuv420p to rgba.
That appears to be the problem.
If you could upload the file as a zip I'll try reproducing the error and see if there is anything that can be done to fix it.

>>dd081ba9-2087-4e33-b4bc-948d44a40928
These files haven't changed in a while.
But yeah it seems it was an OOM that only got triggered with this file.
It should work fine now. ~~Uploading of videos should also be slightly faster.~~

The issue of not being able to upload a zip I couldn't reproduce.

>>caefd8ba-d7db-43d2-ab65-bfceb5949bba
The thumb loaded but ZeroNet didn't find the full file yet.
Is it complaining about the mimetype "application/x-7z-compressed"?

>>caefd8ba-d7db-43d2-ab65-bfceb5949bba
>>00c9bfdf-0dd7-46e2-81ce-26d341e2788a
It finally loaded. `application/x-zip-compressed` is whitelisted now so it should work fine in the future.
There was also a problem with the last modification.
The thumbnail for that video ==should== be created now instead of being blank.
That applies to all valid codecs.

''Reminder to always run your unit tests.''
Thanks for the help.

>>a616546a-b585-4b56-a764-caf61b933546
All of them worked fine. Just the thumbs that weren't created.
It seems like a Chromium issue.
>DECODER_ERROR_NOT_SUPPORTED: Audio configuration specified 2 channels, but FFmpeg thinks the file contains 1 channels

Firefox created without problem.

>>8e22a1e6-5408-40c5-859a-1888d8e297d2
>then i am automatically seeding these files even the board is hidden/blacklisted for me
Yes. "Help seed user files..." will automatically download all files created in the user's directory.
It has no knowledge about which board it is being posted to.
Therefore, it can't filter to prevent downloading files from boards that have been blacklisted.

Only help share files of people you trust enough not to share anything that you don't want to help distribute.

>just that bulk deleting board, thread content is not easily accessible.
It should be trivial to implement it.
Create a new "Delete all files" button in the board menu which will call a new function that implements the [delete behavior of  blacklistBoard](https://gitgud.io/millchan/Millchan/-/blob/master/js/millchan/millchan.ts#L574).
You can open a merge request if you want.

>>d6c96a77-5e6e-4f47-8f05-59f0b68e271e
You typed more there than what you would have to actually fix the issue.
>Someone edited the file the same time you did.
Sounds like a bug with the web IDE.
Doing the changes locally then opening the PR from a new branch should work fine.

>>d6c96a77-5e6e-4f47-8f05-59f0b68e271e
The button should be available now. Thanks.
